location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 324: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell refers to one of his earlier letters, no. 74, dated 22 July 1850, which regarded accusations made against the Agent at Shiraz, Mirza Mahmood. Hennell encloses a copy of his letter, no. 317, dated 14 August 1850, to His Excellency Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil. The letter is not included here, but it does appear as an individual item earlier in the file (see ff.112-114).
